alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Pittsburg; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:28AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Crawford, Haskell, southeastern McIntosh, Sequoyah, northeastern Latimer, southern Adair, northwestern Le Flore, southeastern Cherokee, northeastern Pittsburg and southeastern Muskogee Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 328 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Marble City to 4 miles northwest of Enterprise. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Eufaula... Stigler... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Warner... Vian... Quinton... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 274 and 328. Interstate 49 between mile markers 24 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Pittsburg; Sequoyah
